definition: (onom.) to squeak (of mice)/to chirp or peep (of small birds)
(onom.) to squeak (of mice)/to chirp or peep (of small birds)

sentences.english: The mouse squeaked in the corner.
sentences.chinese: 墙角处有老鼠的吱吱声。

sentences.english: My feet took turns kicking at the thick snow, making a dull squeaking sound.
sentences.chinese: 我的脚轮流踩在厚厚的雪地上，发出单调的吱吱声。

sentences.english: Every time they hear a few Russian felt boots swishing in the snow.
sentences.chinese: 他们不过听到几个俄国人靴子在雪地上的吱吱声。

sentences.english: With a rusty squeak, a pair of steel doors slid open.
sentences.chinese: 伴随这因生锈而发出的吱吱声，两扇钢门打开了。

sentences.english: The brakes of the car squealed.
I finally managed to cure the rattling noise in my car.
sentences.chinese: 我最终设法解决了汽车发出的吱吱声。

sentences.english: Squeak coming from wood beams becomes semitone of well water.
sentences.chinese: 木梁的吱吱声成了井水的伴音。

sentences.english: What the divergent announcements amount to is the squeak of a very rusty wheel: the wheel of Chinese-Japanese cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 当中的分歧如同生锈的中日合作之轮发出的吱吱声。

definition: (onom.) scraping sound/ripping of fabric/screeching of tires
(onom.) for crack, slap, clap, clatter etc
